contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox German district| name=Pfaffenhofen| state=Bavaria| capital=[[Pfaffenhofen a.d.Ilm]]| regierungsbezirk=[[Oberbayern]]| region=Ingolstadt| area=760|Kreisschlüssel = 09186 | population=111,700| population_as_of=2000| density=147| carsign=PAF| url=[http://www.landkreis-pfaffenhofen.de/ landkreis-pfaffenhofen.de]| map=Bavaria paf.png }} {{Audio|Pfaffenhofen.ogg|'''Pfaffenhofen'''}} is a district in [[Bavaria]], [[Germany]]. It is bounded by (from the south and clockwise) the districts of [[Eichstätt (district)|Eichstätt]], [[Kelheim (district)|Kelheim]], [[Freising (district)|Freising]], [[Dachau (district)|Dachau]] and [[Neuburg-Schrobenhausen]], and the city of [[Ingolstadt]]. ==History== In early medieval times the region was partially property of the powerful monasteries of Ilmmünster and Münchsmünster, and partially divided into tiny secular states. One of those states was the county of Scheyern. The counts were ancestors of the [[Wittelsbach]] family, who in 1180 became rulers of Bavaria. From that time on the region was a part of Bavaria. The district of Pfaffenhofen was established in 1972 by merging several former districts. ==Geography== The district is located in the Hallertau Plains between the [[Isar]] and [[Danube]] rivers. The Danube crosses the northernmost part of the district. ==Coat of arms== {| |- valign=top || [[image:Wappen Landkreis Pfaffenhofen an der Ilm.svg|120px|Coat of arms]] ||The coat of arms displays: * the blue and white checked pattern of Bavaria * a cross symbolising the monastery of Scheyern * a branch of hops |} ==Towns and municipalities== {| ! align=left width=33%|Towns ! align=left width=33%|Municipalities ! align=left width=33%| |- valign=top || #[[Geisenfeld]] #[[Pfaffenhofen an der Ilm]] #[[Vohburg]] || #[[Baar-Ebenhausen]] #[[Ernsgaden]] #[[Gerolsbach]] #[[Hettenshausen]] #[[Hohenwart]] #[[Ilmmünster]] #[[Jetzendorf]] #[[Manching]] || <ol start=9> <li>[[Münchsmünster]] <li>[[Pörnbach]] <li>[[Reichertshausen]] <li>[[Reichertshofen]] <li>[[Rohrbach, Bavaria|Rohrbach]] <li>[[Scheyern]] <li>[[Schweitenkirchen]] <li>[[Wolnzach]] </ol> |} ==International cooperation== {| These are the official sister cities {| class="wikitable" "text-align:left;font-size:100%;"| |- ! style="background: #811541; color: #FFFFFF" | ! style="background: #811541; color: #FFFFFF" height="17" width="150" | Country ! style="background: #810001; color: #FFFFFF" width="120" | City ! style="background: #811541; color: #FFFFFF" width="100" | County / District / Region / State |- | style="background: #FFFFEF; color: #000000" | {{Flagicon|Serbia}} | style="background: #FFFFEF; color: #000000" | [[Serbia]] | style="background: #FFFFCF; color: #000000" | '''[[Valjevo]]''' | style="background: #FFFFEF; color: #000000" | ''[[Kolubara District]]'' |- |} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commons category|Landkreis Pfaffenhofen a.d.Ilm}} * [http://www.landkreis-pfaffenhofen.de/ Official website] (German) {{Germany_districts_bavaria}} {{Coord|48.5|11.5|display=title|format=dms}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Pfaffenhofen (District)}} [[Category:Districts of Bavaria]] [[Category:Pfaffenhofen (district)| ]]
